Show key to Racecards

Form Icons

To give you a quick snapshot of each horse’s form we’ve introduced the following icons which represent the following:

  • CD Course & Distance
  • D Distance
  • C Course
  • Hcp Today’s Official Rating or Higher
  • G Going
  • HG Headgear
  • Cl Class
  • S Surface
  • Grey icons indicate horses that have been placed under those conditions.
  • Blue icons indicate horses that have won under those conditions.
  • Gold icons indicate horses with a 50% or better win record under those conditions.

You can gain more information by hovering your mouse over the horse name or icons.

The following symbols sometimes appear alongside an Official Rating:

  • WS This horse received Wind Surgery prior to this run
  • WS2 This was the horse's second outing after receiving Wind Surgery
  • 2 Horse is due to go xlb down in future race
  • 2 Horse is due to go xlb up in future races
  • Verdict
  • Expert View Verdict
  • Individual Race Printouts

Alondra was in receipt of 4lb from EL BUFALO when she completed the second leg of a C&D brace on Friday, but she has a double penalty to carry this time and the runner-up can reverse the form on the revised terms. Lion's House has also been in good form of late and he steps back up in class with a realistic chance of being a key player in what could turn out to be a tactical affair.

Top Tip: El Bufalo (2)
Watch out for: Alondra (1)

Alondra got the better of EL BUFALO and Gogo Yubari here last time and the trio could have this between them once again. The winner that day got first run on the other pair having sat just off the frontrunner but his 5lb rise in the weights is offset by her jockey's claim so she holds every chance again. The latter has held her form well in defeat since completing a double at the start of the year but does appear to be in the grip of the handicapper at present. It is the gelding who is preferred after finishing well last time despite a wide trip throughout at this sharp venue. He was in career best form prior to that defeat so if he can get an early position here from a better draw he could reverse the form.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. El Bufalo (2)
  2. Alondra (1)
  3. Gogo Yubari (4)

Rambuso Creek is too well handicapped to totally ignore and he could offer some each-way value if he steps forward from an improved Southwell effort. However, a chance is taken on INSTANT BOND, who has been the subject of good support on a couple of occasions this winter. He still has more to offer over this trip and could be a surprise package on his first run here. Bad Habits and Oldbury Lad are more obvious ones to monitor in the betting.

Top Tip: Instant Bond (5)
Watch out for: Rambuso Creek (1)

BAD HABITS has held his form well in defeat since winning over C&D at the end of last year. His latest run is worth marking up as he did much the best of those forcing the pace and he's effectively 2lb lower here with his jockey's claim. Rambuso Creek still has to prove his stamina for 7f but he finished well over 6f last time and he's been hinting at a revival of a much reduced mark of late. He can fill the places with Instant Bond who was unusually below par last time but was in good form previously.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Bad Habits (7)
  2. Rambuso Creek (1)
  3. Haziym (2)

With her yard in good form, LOVETHISWAYAGAIN is hard to ignore. After filling the runner-up slot behind a couple of useful types on her last two starts, the daughter of No Nay Never wouldn't need much of a step forward to go one better. Arishka's Dream is rated just 2lb inferior to the selection, but the terms of this maiden leave her with a stiff task ahead. Therefore, the unexposed Perola, a half-brother to a couple of all-weather winners, could be a bigger danger with Donagh Murphy claiming 7lb.

Top Tip: Lovethiswayagain (5)
Watch out for: Perola (2)

A weak contest can go to the experienced LOVETHISWAYAGAIN who sets the standard on her pair of recent runner up efforts. She split a pair of in form rivals last time over C&D and a repeat would be enough. Perola was turned over at short odds last time but holds strong claims on the basis of his debut runner up effort though he does have his fitness to prove after an absence. If getting a fast pace to settle off as he did last time then Arishka's Dream will also be competitive.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Lovethiswayagain (5)
  2. Perola (2)
  3. Arishka's Dream (3)

HIERARCHY's latest start proved he retains the ability to swoop and conquer in a race of this nature and a 3lb rise for his Lingfield win is manageable. Silky Wilkie set a scorching pace in that race and the revised terms give him a feasible chance of holding on to better than that fourth-placed finish. Papa Cocktail, who had the measure of his nearest rival Water Of Leith when he won over C&D last month, is another to seriously consider, despite a 5lb rise.

Top Tip: Hierarchy (3)
Watch out for: Silky Wilkie (1)

Veteran SILKY WILKIE has returned to form of late and remains very well treated on his old efforts. The former Scottish Sprint Cup winner's last run is worth marking up considerably as he was taken on up front before tiring late. If going a more sensible gallop he can get the better of Lequinto who was back in form until failing to stay 7f last time. He can quickly bounced back returned to a suitable distance and fill the places with veteran Hierarchy who has been thriving of late but will need a bit more off this revised mark.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Silky Wilkie (1)
  2. Lequinto (7)
  3. Hierarchy (3)

BEAUZON has been in unstoppable form of late and it would be dangerous to assume an 8lb penalty is enough to prevent him from completing a five-timer. Considering that Ryan Kavanagh reduces the burden to 3lb with his claim, connections have given the seven-year-old every chance of extending the winning sequence. Last-time-out C&D winner He's An Angel is still well handicapped, despite going up 3lb, and is very capable of spoiling the party for the selection. Ardaddy and Sioux Warrior can also go close.

Top Tip: Beauzon (3)
Watch out for: He's An Angel (5)

BEAUZON can continue the winning sequence here. He had a bit in hand when winning last time despite being ridden very aggressively suggesting that this sharper track will suit. His 4lb rise is more than offset by his jockey's claim so he should be tough to beat. The consistent Ardaddy is just 2lb above his last winning mark and looks an obvious danger along with He's An Angel. That rival snapped a long losing run last time and remains very well treated on his old form.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Beauzon (3)
  2. He's An Angel (5)
  3. Ardaddy (7)

Taryn Langley was on board when MAGIC RUNNER struck over slightly further here last month and Ruth Carr's filly has acquitted herself well in defeat twice since. She was only beaten two lengths off this mark most recently so still seems feasibly treated with the 5lb claimer retained. Dandy Khan arrives in decent form but she has stamina to prove. Therefore, Three On Thursday, who has gone off favourite on her last couple of outings, is put forward as the primary threat.

Top Tip: Magic Runner (3)
Watch out for: Three On Thursday (6)

THREE ON THURSDAY was a 10f winner at the end of last year and has held her form well in defeat since. She showed a willing attitude last time when outstayed over 12f and is fancied to build on that back down in distance off an unchanged mark. The consistent multiple course winner Magic Runner also drops in trip and looks the obvious danger while at a bigger price top weight Renesmee is also respected. Her form has tailed off recently but she is now back on a winning mark and will appreciate this stiffer test than last time.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Three On Thursday (6)
  2. Magic Runner (3)
  3. Renesmee (1)

Hackney Diamonds has made the frame twice since a Southwell triumph last month and should be in the thick of the action again. Little Miss India took a big step back in the right direction when touched off at Lingfield, but this can go the way of ZENATO. The Fergal O'Brien-trained five-year-old registered a double over hurdles back in the autumn and can capitalise on what could be a lenient rating back in this sphere.

Top Tip: Zenato (6)
Watch out for: Hackney Diamonds (7)

In form HACKNEY DIAMONDS gets the verdict here. She was let down by a slow start last time but still ran well and the form of her win last month has been boosted significantly. With her jockey's claim here she is racing off the same mark and can defeat Little Miss India who was just out-battled late by a strong stayer over 12f last time. She arrives in good form and can fill the places with recent hurdles winner Zenato who hasn't been seen in this sphere for a while but could be on a generous mark.

1-2-3 Selections

  1. Hackney Diamonds (7)
  2. Little Miss India (4)
  3. Zenato (6)
